summary: The Drain the Swamp Act of 2025 mandates executive agencies to relocate their headquarters outside the Washington, D.C., metropolitan area.  Each agency head must submit a relocation plan to Congress, identifying new locations, maximizing cost savings, ensuring no more than 10% of employees remain in the D.C. area, and considering national security impacts. The plan must be certified by the OMB Director and GSA Administrator and implemented by September 30, 2030.
